import { Meta, Story } from "@storybook/addon-docs/blocks";
import Input from "./Input.vue";

<Meta title="Input" component={Input} />

# Input

Text inputs allow users to enter a single line of text.

## When to Use

- Input text is no longer than a single line
- Users have to input an answer that cannot be easily predicted

## When not to Use

- A user needs to input multiple lines of text
- Users can only choose from a selected list of responses

## API

| Prop        | Type    | Required | Description                                                                                    | Default |
| ----------- | ------- | -------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- |
| label       | string  | false    | value of the heading label for the input field                                                 | ""      |
| id          | string  | true     | value of the unique identifier for the input field                                             |         |
| value       | string  | false    | actual value present in the input field                                                        | ""      |
| placeholder | string  | false    | placeholder string present in the input field                                                  | ""      |
| isRequired  | boolean | true     | value representing whether the input field is mandatory or not                                 |         |
| errorMsg    | string  | false    | value to be displayed as an error message if the value entered in the input field is incorrect | ""      |
| styling     | string  | true     | css classes to apply styling to the input field                                                |         |
| note        | string  | false    | note for the label of the input field                                                          | ""      |
| isReadOnly  | boolean | false    | if true, the input field is non-editable                                                       | false   |

<br />

## Editable White With Label

The most commonly used input field with a label heading.

<Story
  name="Editable White With Label"
  id="input--editable-white-with-label"
></Story>

```bash
<Input
  v-bind:label="Label Heading"
  v-bind:id="textInputId"
  v-bind:placeholder="Enter value"
  v-bind:isRequired="false"
  v-bind:styling="bcgov-editable-white"
/>
```

## Editable White Mandatory

This is a mandatory field.

<Story
  name="Editable White Mandatory"
  id="input--editable-white-mandatory"
></Story>

```bash
<Input
  v-bind:label="Label Heading"
  v-bind:id="textInputId"
  v-bind:placeholder="Enter value"
  v-bind:styling="bcgov-editable-white"
  v-bind:isRequired="true"
/>
```

## Editable White No Label

Input field with no label heading.

<Story
  name="Editable White No Label"
  id="input--editable-white-no-label"
></Story>

```bash
<Input
  v-bind:label=""
  v-bind:id="textInputId"
  v-bind:placeholder="Enter value"
  v-bind:isRequired="false"
  v-bind:styling="bcgov-editable-white"
/>
```

## Non Editable Grey

Input field that is non-editable. Used for values that are constant.

<Story name="Non Editable Grey" id="input--non-editable-grey"></Story>

```bash
<Input
  v-bind:label="Label Heading"
  v-bind:id="textInputId"
  v-bind:placeholder="Enter value"
  v-bind:isReadOnly="true"
  v-bind:isRequired="false"
  v-bind:styling="bcgov-non-editable-grey"
/>
```

## With Error Message

Input field with an error message, meaning that the value in the input field is incorrect.

<Story name="With Error Message" id="input--with-error-message"></Story>

```bash
<Input
  v-bind:label="Label Heading"
  v-bind:id="textInputId"
  v-bind:value="some wrong value"
  v-bind:isRequired="false"
  v-bind:styling="bcgov-editable-white"
  v-bind:errorMsg="There is an error."
/>
```
